title: How to Make Roasted Red Pepper Soup

steps.headline: Roast the peppers directly on the grill or in the broiler turning the peppers often until the skins are blistered and charred.
steps.description: Remove from grill or broiler and place in a paper bag. Close the bag tightly and allow the peppers to steam for about 10 minutes. Open the bag and remove the peppers, slip skins off carefully; halve the peppers and cut out the core, seeds, and white membranes.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a deep pot or skillet; add onions, garlic, and herbs.
Sauté until onions are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add wine and cook down quickly to 1 Tablespoon.
Add potato, peppers, stock, thyme, and red pepper flakes.
steps.description: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes, until potatoes and peppers are tender.

steps.headline: In a blender or with an immersion blender, puree mixture until smooth.
To serve warm, serve immediately and garnish with your choice of toppings.
To serve chilled, cool the soup, then cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or as long as 2 days.

text: Roast the peppers directly on the grill or in the broiler turning the peppers often until the skins are blistered and charred. Remove from grill or broiler and place in a paper bag. Close the bag tightly and allow the peppers to steam for about 10 minutes. Open the bag and remove the peppers, slip skins off carefully; halve the peppers and cut out the core, seeds, and white membranes. Heat the oil in a deep pot or skillet; add onions, garlic, and herbs.  Sauté until onions are soft, about 5 minutes.  Add wine and cook down quickly to 1 Tablespoon.  Add potato, peppers, stock, thyme, and red pepper flakes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes, until potatoes and peppers are tender. In a blender or with an immersion blender, puree mixture until smooth. Adjust seasonings to taste. To serve warm, serve immediately and garnish with your choice of toppings.  To serve chilled, cool the soup, then cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or as long as 2 days.
